{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.05432v1", "title": "Boundary Energy-Momentum Tensors for Asymptotically Flat Spacetimes", "summary": "We consider 3D and 4D asymptotically flat spacetimes near future null
infinity endowed with the most general allowed Carroll geometry. We define a
boundary energy-momentum tensor by varying the on-shell action with respect to
the Carroll metric data. This requires adding counterterms to the
Einstein-Hilbert action. We show that, in 4D, the shear is on par with the
Carroll metric data. Their combined response defines a boundary
energy-momentum-news complex whose diffeomorphism Ward identity is equivalent
to the Bondi mass and angular momentum loss equations. Weyl invariance leads to
an identity for the trace of the energy-momentum tensor, and local Carroll
boosts are anomalous in 3D and in 4D.", "main_category": "hep-th", "categories": "hep-th,gr-qc", "published": "2025-05-08T17:22:02Z"}
